reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: awesome stay at the hotel. staff was friendly and sweet. however, a couple days later, i checked my credit card statement and they overcharged us ~$100 for room service, valet, water, etc. that was included in the package we purchased. when we called to get it corrected, i was on hold for at least 30 min. being transferred from one person to the next until I spoke with an EXTREMELY rude accountant who acted like she was doing me a favor by correcting the charges. i offered to fax in the receipt which clearly shows the charges and the link to their own website that spells out what the package we purchased includes. will never stay here again because i dont want to deal with the wrongful charges afterwards.
reviews.title: check your bill!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very good hotel indeed and I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Outstanding service in a superb hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with some of the points made in some of the other reviews in that it is fairly traditional and not as hip as the nearby W.
reviews.title: Flawless and fun

reviews.text: Having said that, the rooms are a very good size and the beds are extremely comfortable. The maid service is excellent and they leave your room immaculate but you can still find your stuff easily enough. We had a corner room, with superb views over midtown Atlanta. We did, however, reject our first 2 rooms; the first due the smell of smoke and the second due to a squeaky bed. The hotel did not have any problem with my being a fussy customer.
reviews.title: Great weekend with friends! Looking for wedding site... old and outdated!!!

reviews.text: The Spa is extremely nice, with a beautiful pool and very clean and well equipped locker rooms. The gym is quite small, as you often find in a city centre hotel.
reviews.title: Peace on Peachtree

reviews.text: In ATL for 3 nights with my 10yo kid, and we really enjoyed our stay at the Four Seasons. Excellent, attentive service from the moment of our arrival - followed with a fast check-in, room upgrade to a high floor with great downtown view (exactly what we requested), superb concierge services, and a fast & friendly valet who gave us bottled water on every departure, & even tidied our car and discarded our garbage on our return. Grt job from all the staff on name recognition, & following up on suggested activities & restaurants. Nice pool & spa - gym also nice & adequately equipped. Very nice, quiet lounge - grt drinks (pricey) and apps (reasonable) -- breakfast (expensive), although tasty, was cold, and wasn't much warmer after we sent it all back.
reviews.title: Nice Stay!

reviews.text: Room was a decent size for the 2 of us - clean and nice, albeit very plain & completely lacked any sort of a "wow" factor. But, again, very clean!! Comfy bed/pillows. Very quiet. Bathroom was fine - full of marble - tiny shower but plenty of hot water. No chocolates on turn-down made my kid sad. No free in-room wireless mad me sad, but computers were available downstairs.
reviews.title: Not what I am accustomed to from The Four Seasons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great rate (but 2 nights get the third free). Much better deal than we were offered at the Ritz and/or Mansion. Nice mid-town location - convenient to everything including MARTA, easy highway access, and plenty of excellent restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Far short of what I expect from Four Seasons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a very nice hotel whose in-room decor limits were overshadowed by the excellent, warm & attentive service provided by the entire staff. Clean, quiet and beautiful common areas, together with superb service, made for a beautiful, quiet and relaxing stay in ATL - exactly what we were looking for. I'd absolutely recommend without hesitation.
reviews.title: Four Seasons really is Four Star!

reviews.text: I am a huge fan of Four Seasons hotels. My recent stay in Atlanta was not consistent with my other experiences. This hotel appears to struggle to maintain Four Season standards. Although it is not an old hotel, the rooms are not particularly large and the bathrooms are outdated. It pales terribly in comparison to the Mansion or the St. Regis. While some of the staff was very good and tried very hard, others were not as good.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: I hate that I am the first one to write an average review, because I like to think of myself as a positive person. But I thought the Four Seasons Atlanta was just okay. We stayed there for my husband's birthday last night, and while the lobby was gorgeous with marble walls, it not that large or great. The people and service was more than I could ever expect from anyplace, everyone went out of their way to be friendly and ask if we needed anything.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.text: The room, was pretty much like any other room we have stayed in (Marriott's, etc.) but we were surprised to not have a coffee maker in our room. The bathroom was large and beautiful, I would stay a step or two above a Marriott.
reviews.title: The way it should be.

reviews.text: However, we were awakened at 6:30am by a drill or some large appliance that sounded like it was making a hole in our ceiling. Coming in late the night before, we were not very happy. They are renovating the rooms, however I wish they could have waited til at least 8am on a Sat. morning. Friday night, my husband left to get ice and came back half an hour later. The ice maker was broken on our floor, he tried the four floors below us (by stairs, elevator would not go) and still no ice. He finally went to one of the bottom floors to get some. They also gave us the wrong key to our refridgerator. But someone did proptly bring the correct one up to us.
reviews.title: Four Seasons is the best!

reviews.text: We did eat and have some drinks at the restaurant and the service and food was OUTSTANDING! Worth every penny. We were told on the phone and when we arrived that we have a view overlooking "midtown". Well, I think they meant the midtown of the ghetto. It was nothing to brag about.
reviews.title: Fabulous Four Seasons

reviews.text: We paid $265 for our room and I just didn't feel like we got our money's worth. We will stick with the Marriott, pay half the price, and have the same room with a larger lobby. I was really let down as we have been looking forward to staying in a Four Seasons for quite sometime.
reviews.title: Late Review, but Good News-4 Seaons is Great!
One of the Best When It Comes to Service
reviews.text: With all the new 5 star hotels such as the St. Regis, InterContinental, and the W, opening up in Atlanta, one would be possibly hesitant about staying at the Four Seasons in Midtown Atlanta. After all, its been around since 1992; which means its probably outdated. However, they just a finished an immaculate renovation of all the rooms, plus they have a new spa which I highly recommend to get a massage at. I have stayed at the Four Season in Atlanta probably 100 times. And there has not been one time that I did not thoroughly enjoy my stay. The staff is one of the best I have ever dealt with. Everybody from the front desk to the concierge, to the valet, treat you like you are the only person in the hotel. By the way, the best room service of any hotel I have ever stayed at. If you order breakfast, order either the pancakes or the poached eggs and corn beef hash. Plus, they make the best cheese grits I have ever tasted. You can have the St. Regis, the W, the Rosewood on Peachtree, wherever. However, you will not get the same outstanding service like you do at the Four Seasons. Hail the Four Seasons brand and hail the Four Seasons Atlanta!

This was a brief weekend stay to visit family and enjuy midtown Atlanta. the hotel staff hare even more helpful, friendly and professional than previous visits. the new spa is an excellent addtiion. Dan gave me the best sports massage I have had in a decade. The facility is clean, quiet and classy. Pool is outstanding for an urban high rise hotel. there is a small deck for sunning. Room was great. got an upgrade to a corner suite. It had every amenity and a fantastic view of the downtown.
reviews.title: four Seasons Exceeds itself

reviews.text: While the location may not be the best in Atlanta, this hotel is solid in terms of service, quality, and value. It is quite clean, well-maintained, and is one of the better hotels in the "Ritz / Four Seasons" - type hotels.
reviews.title: Top-Notch Hotel and Great Service
Excellent service
reviews.text: I stayed here for business in January for a night. IThe service was quite nice. The lady in the reception was very helpful. I had breakfast in the restaurant - the food was really good. Will stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from a weekend stay at the Four Seasons. It was the first time to ever stay there and although we had heard it was among the nicest hotels in the Southeast, the level of service was unbelievable. Everyone knew our names and called us by name the entire weekend, and not like they were looking for an extra tip or anything, but in a friendly, professional and courteous manner. We ate dinner and breakfast at the Park 75 restaurant and words can't do justice to the meal. It was like an event all by itself, with every dish being more beautiful than the first. I had the trout with shrimp remoulade and a side of broccolini. Some of the best food I have ever come near, much less had the pleasure of eating. Breakfast was an egg-white frittata with fresh basil, smoked tomato sauce and part-skim mozzerella with multi-grain toast and a bowl of fruit that I am posting a photo of. We had a room on the 17th floor that was roomy, nicely appointed with views that took my breath away, and it was quiet and relaxing. The only downside is that we can't live there full-time. Our favorite hotel, without a doubt.
reviews.title: World-Class Service, Elegance and Atmosphere

reviews.text: Our family of four stayed at the FS Atlanta over Thanksgiving 2008 (Nov 26-29).
reviews.title: A very nice FS stay

reviews.text: The FS Atlanta hotel and staff met all of our expectations. We booked two adjoining rooms and were pleased with the quality of the rooms. Upon arrival, welcome cupcakes and milk were waiting for the two children. They had sponges spelling out their names in the bathroom and the correct child-sized robes were already waiting for them. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job throughout our stay. The adults also had fruit and water waiting when we arrived.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: We dined daily in the hotel and were pleased with the selection for breakfast. The staff were always very kind to us and our children and the food was excellent. We opted for the Thanksgiving brunch (as opposed to the five course dinner) and really enjoyed the presentation, variety and quality of the offerings. There was also a bento box for the children which offered their favorites like chicken tenders, macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes and more. The staff handled the change in our reservation (we had originally booked the dinner) with characteristic ease. We also enjoyed a lovely room service dinner on Thanksgiving and both the service and food were excellent.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in MIdtown

likes.liked: — the room, the lounge, the front desk staff
likes.disliked: — the concierge Louis needs to get a better attitude

reviews.text: The hotel is within easy walking distance (for our 7 & 9 year old) to the High Museum of Art where we enjoyed the art, two audio tours with family friendly narrative, and crafts for the holiday. We drove to the Georgia Aquarium which was about 15 minutes away and enjoyed that immensely on Thanksgiving. While the hotel is located in a business district, we were within a block of good restaurants on either side. There was a Starbucks and an Einstein's Bros. bagel two doors down. At our request, the concierge recommended two restaurants- Veni, Vidi, Vici and Tamarind Seed. Both were within walking distance and very accommodating to us and our children. V3 easily made a substitution to their delicious Italian menu. Tamarind was very conscious of our child's food allergy.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, A very expensive bottle of Evian

reviews.text: Back in the hotel itself, we enjoyed the indoor pool immensely. The staff in the fitness area was friendly. The pool was clean and well-stocked and large enough for several groups of guests.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.liked: — room and city view were spectacular

reviews.title: A Good Weekend Experience
reviews.text: We just returned from a weekend celebration for my husband's 45th birthday. We also took our kids with us ages 6 and 8. They were welcomed with a big cookie on a plate with their names written in chocolate along with cold milk that was left in the private bar in the room. They absolutely loved this, my 6 year old was elated that his name was spelled correctly.
